intro: Gulubia palauensis, commonly known as the Palau morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the island of Palau in the Western Pacific. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible seeds that are often consumed locally. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found growing near water sources. Gulubia palauensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
